boat.name: Airy Mouse

owners.note: 'Airy Mouse' was sold in 1999 (National Historic Ships records)

boat.full_description:
Built in Fowey, 1894, 'Airy Mouse' was designed by a Cornish artist, Edwin Brett, in 1891 for the Commodore of the Royal Fowey Yacht Club, Mr. Edward Atkinson. Originally a cutter, she was converted to a gaff ketch sometime before 1988 when she was being restored by Alan Tate who wrote a letter to the OGA Gaffers Log seeking information about her.

'Airy Mouse' spent most of her life prior to the 1980s on the south coast of England with a short period in Guernsey where she was rescued from being burnt for her copper fastenings by John Clluett. Her figurehead (a bat, 'Airy Mouse' being Cornish for bat) is in the Royal Fowey YC.
boat.short_description: 'Airy Mouse' was built in Fowey and launched in 1894 at Watty's yard.
